predefined_profiles.name: Liu Jiye
predefined_profiles.public profile: Liu Jiye is the son of Liu Chenggang. He believes his family is very poor and is often bullied by classmates in class. After returning home, he needs to take care of his paraplegic grandmother. He has a strong sense of morality and self-respect.
predefined_profiles.goal: To be a competent son and not disappoint his parents.
predefined_profiles.private profile: He likes his classmate Xiaohong, but has never confessed.

predefined_profiles.name: Old Liu
predefined_profiles.public profile: A renowned businessman in Q City. He was impoverished in his early years but, through fate and hard work, achieved significant success. He has two sons: the eldest was spoiled and failed in education, thus sent to study in America. Therefore, he decided to raise his second son strictly. Their family moved into a rundown old-style house, which has a secret passage leading to a basement. The basement was turned into a secret base used to observe Liu Jiye's behavior at home and at school.
predefined_profiles.goal: To make Jiye endure hardships and cultivate Liu Jiye into a qualified successor.

scenario: Liu Jiye is currently in elementary school. On this day, during recess, he's discussing electronic products with his classmates. His parents often prevent him from playing on the computer due to concerns about his studies.

profile.name: Ma Li
profile.public profile: Liu Chenggang's wife, Liu Jiye's mother. After marrying Liu Chenggang, she led the life of a rich housewife, but since her husband decided to raise their second son with austerity, she has to pretend to be from a poor family, which she's not happy about.
profile.goal: Hopes her son Liu Jiye can pass Liu Chenggang's test and become a qualified heir.

profile.name: Wang Shui
profile.public profile: Classmate of Liu Jiye, his father owns a car dealership, and his family is well-off. He often shows off in front of his classmates.
profile.goal: To be a happy second-generation rich kid.

dialog.content: Liu Jiye is currently in elementary school. Today, during a break, he is discussing electronics with his classmates. His parents often don't let him use the computer, fearing it will affect his studies.
(Pulls out the iPad his dad bought him from his backpack) Hey everyone, look at this. This is the latest model iPad my dad bought me. Jealous?
(Looks at the iPad eagerly) Wang Shui, can you lend me the iPad to play for a few days? I'll return it to you next Monday.
Lend it to you? Dream on. With your family's financial condition, you'll never afford this in a lifetime. Besides, if you damage it, how could you afford to compensate?
I won't just borrow your iPad for free. How about I give you one yuan every week?
One yuan? Are you kidding? Even if you keep it up for a month, it won't cover the shipping for this iPad.

content.content: Don't say that. If money's a problem, how about I do your homework for a month?
Fine, if you don't accept, there's nothing I can do. Play your games alone then; you'll end up a gaming addict with no friends.
Do you really have to pay extra for shipping when buying an iPad now? Doesn't such an expensive gadget include free shipping?
Why are you mad? Getting angry harms you, remember, anger is bad for your health.

question: #question#How can Liu Jiye convey that he can manage his anger and frustration when facing Wang Shui's taunts and insults?

content.content: If not, then not. I'm not talking to you anymore. I need to focus on my homework. My dad said if I make it to the top ten in the midterm, he'll take me on a trip. I need to put 200% effort into my practice exercises now.
Look at you, always thinking about game consoles and iPads, never prioritizing your studies. If you focused more on learning, your grades would have improved by now.
I was just testing you to see if you'd prioritize your friends. Now I know you're not my friend. We're not brothers. I'm going to study, don't waste my energy anymore.
Not lending, huh? I'll just go study. Just wait, I'll tell the teacher you brought an iPad to class. Lend it to me, or they'll confiscate it, your choice.

question: #question#How can Liu Jiye express that he can effectively regulate his energy and improve his study efficiency when facing Wang Shui's provocations?

dialog.content: (Knowing that Liu Jiye's family is not well-off, but he always ranks top in studies) You can help me with my homework, that's fine, but I can lend you my iPad on Tuesday and Thursday evenings, other times I need it for myself.
Of course, of course, deal! I'll help you with today's homework right now. It's Tuesday today, remember to lend it to me!
(Already calculated his son's time for coming home after school, he has returned to the room from the underground base) Hey, son, you're back. Do you want to eat first or do homework?
I'll do homework first, I'll eat later, you let mom prepare it.
(Feeling gratified after hearing the reply about doing homework first) Alright, good luck son, finish your homework early and come eat.
(Liu Jiye has been in the study for almost an hour now) Jiye, do you have a lot of homework today? It's taking longer than usual, why don't you have dinner first, then continue afterward.

content.content: (Wanting to play a little longer with the iPad, quickly thinking of a response to mom) Yes, the teacher gave some difficult problems today. I've been thinking about this one for a long time, give me a bit more time; if I have dinner now, my train of thought will be disrupted.
Just keep my meal for me, I finally got my classmate’s iPad, let me finish this game first, I'll eat afterward, just heat it up in the microwave, thanks mom!
There's a lot of homework today, the headteacher was in a bad mood and gave us a lot extra, these questions are very hard, I don't really feel like eating now.
What’s for dinner today? What dishes do we have? I’d really like some Kung Pao Chicken, with less chili. Did you make it? I really want to eat it, skipping it would make me anxious.

question: #question# What should Liu Jiye say to better manage stress and tension when responding to his mother's inquiries?

content.content: Coming, I'll be right there to eat, thank you mom, you worked hard today, I'll give you a shoulder rub later.
Thanks mom, you eat first, I still need a bit more time for my homework, if I get hungry later, I can eat the book pages.
It's raining outside today, it's pretty cold, how about having hotpot, it’s just right to warm up.
Mom, do you think today’s groceries are fresh enough? I got up really early to buy fresh greens from the morning market.

question: #question# What should Liu Jiye say to make his mom feel comfortable and warm?

dialog.content: (Taking advantage of a pause in his son's conversation, he sneaks into his son's room and notices the glow of an iPad screen underneath a pile of books) Jiyi, what are you doing? Are you really doing your homework? Where did the iPad come from?

(Quickly hides the iPad under a stack of books) What? I don’t know what you’re talking about. I’m just reading a book. Why didn’t you knock before coming into my room? You almost gave me a heart attack.
I knocked; you were just too absorbed in your game to hear it. Besides, why are you feeling guilty? I haven’t even said anything yet.
Sorry, Dad. I borrowed the iPad from a classmate to play games. I won't do it again next time.

Old Liu realized that his son couldn't resist the lure of games and had even lied about doing homework to deceive him. He felt a great sense of failure and decided that raising his son frugally wasn't working, so he abandoned this plan.
You spent quite a while on your homework today. Is it getting harder?
It feels tougher than before. I got stuck on a problem for a long time and still couldn’t solve it.
Should we enroll our son in a tutoring class? We can't let him fall behind at this stage.
(winking at Mary) I’d love to sign him up for a class too, but our financial situation isn't great. Son, make sure you use every minute wisely at school and don’t waste any time.
Okay, I’ll study hard at school and ask the teachers if I have any questions.

That night, Old Liu pondered deeply, feeling that his son’s behavior at the dinner table seemed a bit unnatural. Just before sleep, he quietly snuck into his son’s bedroom and found him playing on an iPad. Furious, Old Liu realized that raising a son with financial hardship couldn’t help him succeed, and finally gave up on this plan.

profile.name: Xiao Hong
profile.public profile: Classmate of Liu Jiye, parents run a small shop at the school gate, loves dancing
profile.goal: Get into a dance academy in college

dialog.content: Only Wang Shui likes to show off every day. Look at Liu Jiye; his grades are always at the top.
Hmph, you're just jealous. Can your dad buy you an iPad? I can't be bothered with you guys. I'll play on my own, don't disturb me.
(Thinking about the iPad incident upon returning home at night) Dad, today Wang Shui in our class was teasing me with an iPad, saying I'd never be able to afford one in my life.
Don't worry about useless things every day; as long as your studies are good, that's enough. What's the use of money? There's so many rich people in the world.
(Silently, staring at the chopsticks in the bowl, fiddling with the hem of his clothes) But I think having money is very important. If we had money, our family could live a good life.
You just want to buy an iPad, right? Our family can't afford that much. If you really want to buy it, figure it out yourself. Collecting bottles is one way.

content.content: Collecting bottles would be hard to get enough for an iPad, let's forget it. Maybe I'll get lucky, and a relative or friend will gift me an iPad this month or tomorrow, so I can experience getting something for nothing.
You want me to collect bottles? The cost-effectiveness is too low. I learned probability at school; the chance is even smaller than winning the lottery.
Collect bottles? In this day and age? Besides, you can't earn much by collecting bottles, probably won't make it until the cows come home. Meanwhile, no need to go to school and study then.
Look at our family's situation, maybe by tomorrow someone from the community will visit us, and I could ask them to gift me an iPad.

question: #question# How can Liu Jiye express that he can maintain a positive and optimistic attitude when facing his family's dire situation?

content.content: Alright, collecting bottles is fine. I'm willing to do it. I'll start looking for recyclables to sell for money to save for an iPad tomorrow.
No, think about it; collecting one bottle can at most sell for a dime. How many bottles do I need to collect to buy an iPad? Where are there so many bottles?
If I work hard collecting bottles, can I really afford an iPad? What if I also want to buy an Apple Pencil?
Why do I feel like, when you were young, you bought me an iPad? I remember living in a mansion with a swimming pool when I was small. I want to go back.

question: #question# How can Liu Jiye show that he can set clear and ambitious personal goals during his conversation with Old Liu?

dialog.content: I think you've been reading too many novels. Someone gifting you an iPad is about as likely as winning the lottery.
Don't you always say that people should be optimistic? Life always needs a bit of hope. As long as you keep buying lottery tickets, our family might strike it rich one day.

Is that what I mean by being optimistic? You've got it all wrong. Optimism is an attitude, but the way to get things done is to be diligent with real work. Buying lottery tickets and such are just shortcuts.
Alright, I was just talking, not actually going to buy any lottery tickets or pin all hopes of a better life on that kind of elusive thing.

After much thought, Old Liu felt it was his responsibility that his son was looked down upon by classmates. Having been used to looking down on others himself, he couldn't swallow his pride and eventually bought an iPad for his son, then told him that the family was wealthy.

(After dinner, talking with Mary in the bedroom) Tell me, what's gotten into our son? Why's he so obsessed with getting an iPad? Didn't we move here and pretend to be poor in the first place just so he could get away from all this?
Kids his age see something and they want it too. It's pretty normal, right? You really shouldn't be so hard on him all the time.
(The next day at school, bringing a large woven bag for empty bottles) Hello, classmate. If you have any empty bottles you don’t need, could you give them to me?
You've taken up collecting recyclables now? You think you can get rich picking up bottles?
What I do is none of your business. Just put the bottles in this bag if you have any. If not, move along and don't block the way.
Is it really that serious? I've got a lot of drink bottles. If you want to make a quick buck, I can give them to you, but you have to carry my bag home from school for this month.

content.content: I can carry your bag, sure. I'm not above being a laborer, but you have to keep your promise and give me the bottles first. If you don't give them to me now, there's nothing else to talk about.
Does carrying your bag even make a difference? It's not like it’s full of books. You bring an empty bag just for show every day. That, I might consider.
Stop drinking the soda and just hand over the bottles. I need them to water some flowers, and you'll save yourself the trouble of finding a trash can.
You're already pretty chubby, and you don't exercise or anything, yet you want others to carry your bag? You'll end up with juvenile diabetes if you keep this up.

question: What can Liu Jiye say to show he's sticking to his initial goal during the conversation with Wang Shui?

content.content: Carry your bag? Haha, who do you think you are? Don't try to rile me up with this nonsense. I don't have time for you. Go back where you came from and quit bothering me. I haven't met my bottle collection quota today, so I need to get back to work.

Carry your bag? Haha, who do you think you are? There aren't even that many bottles at school. If you want to make money picking up bottles, you should head to places like Universal Studios or Disneyland.
How much allowance does your dad give you each month? And what do you spend it all on? Don't tell me it's all on drinks and snacks. Where do you toss all those bottles?
Are you just going to stand there and watch me pick up bottles? Where's all that willingness to help others that the teachers taught you? Shouldn't you at least start by helping your classmates?

question: What can Liu Jiye say during his conversation with Wang Shui to demonstrate a strong focus on completing his goal?

dialog.content: Sure, I'll give it to you. Let me take a sip first, and once I finish, it's all yours.

(Temporarily leaving the class, he begins searching for empty bottles in the school trash bins.) With so many people at school, it's a great spot to find bottles. At this rate, saving money shouldn’t be a problem.
(Taking advantage of Liu Jiye's focus on searching, he sneakily brings a group of followers over.) Liu Jiye, I brought some buddies to give you more bottles.
(Noticing a few people behind Wang Shui smirking, he feels things aren't as Wang Shui said.) What are you up to? Don't think that just because there are more of you, I'm afraid.
(Starts instigating and chants a rhyme to mock Liu Jiye) Liu Jiye is such a loser, picking up trash at school every day, picking up trash.
(Even though he's strong-willed, tears up and goes to the teacher's office) Teacher, Wang Shui and others bullied me.

Old Liu received a call from the teacher, feeling mixed emotions after learning his son was mocked by classmates for collecting trash. He decided it was enough and revealed to his son the truth about their wealth, then helped him transfer to a new school.
(Seeing his son come home in the evening with a big bag full of empty bottles) Nice job, son. You really meant what you said and went out to collect bottles!
Of course, but Wang Shui from our class gave me a hard time, saying I had to carry his backpack for a month before he'd give me the bottles.

(Feeling his son's effort isn't easy and has actually secretly bought an iPad. He thinks his son playing games might avoid early romance since he's the type who might go crazy for love) Yesterday, your uncle's company had a team-building lottery, and I happened to win an iPad mini, which he gave to me. Would you like to use it?
Of course I want to, but surely you won't just let me use it for free, right? What's the catch?
You kept your word with the bottle collection, and you deserve some praise. You can use the iPad, but only on Saturdays and Sundays, and for no more than two hours each time.

content.content: Sure, actually I want to use the iPad for drawing, since it makes color adjustment and shaping easier, and the dynamic effects look better. I like a girl in my class and want to draw with her.

Great, the iPad isn't just for playing games, it can also be used for drawing, watching online courses, and learning. I plan to make full use of it, plus I can study together with the girl I like. Dad, you'll support me, right?
Awesome, this weekend I want to invite the girl I like from my class to play games together. Playing alone is no fun. What do you think, Dad?
Dad, have you played Genshin Impact? The characters and story are really attractive, and the girl I like also enjoys it. I can play with her.

question: #question#How should Liu Jiye respond to Old Liu to show he can create and appreciate artistic works?

content.content: No problem, I promise to focus on studying from Monday to Friday and not touch the iPad. Then on weekends, I'll only use it for two hours each day. Besides that, I'll plan my time well and surely complete my study tasks.
Alright, Dad, I'll listen to you and play every Saturday and Sunday, no more than two hours each time. As you wish, my grades will only get better.
How about this, Dad? Can I play the iPad on weekends in intervals, like an hour at a time rather than two hours straight? This kind of time planning can help me balance study and rest.
Dad, can I only use the iPad on weekends? What if I need to look up information during the week? I can plan my weekday time and use the iPad reasonably to help with studying efficiently!

question: #question#In chatting with Old Liu, how should Liu Jiye express that he can effectively manage his time and achieve his goals?

dialog.content: Oh? So you wanted an iPad to draw, I thought you wanted it to play games!
Games are definitely fun, but I'm more interested in the character and background designs. I'm really into graphics.
Since when did you become interested in drawing? You never mentioned it before.
A girl in my class, Xiao Hong, has been taking art lessons on weekends. I've learned a lot from her, and I practice regularly, but I've been afraid to mention it and add to the family's burden.
But are you starting a relationship this early? That's not acceptable.
Dad, it's just a crush...

After buying the iPad, Liu Jiyie interacted more frequently with the girl he liked, and soon neglected his studies. Old Liu found no need to pretend to be poor anymore and revealed the family's true financial situation to his son.
Not bad, very determined. I believe you can do it.

profile.name: Mr. Luo
profile.public profile: Liu Jiye's high school teacher and Chinese language teacher. Very good at teaching and is actively being considered for an outstanding teacher award. Strongly detests under-the-table dealings through authority, frequently urging students to stay focused on their studies and manage their time well.

dialog.content: (As time passes, Liu Jiye has entered high school. On this day, during a public Chinese class, the back rows are filled with teachers evaluating the lecture. Mr. Luo is discussing the relationship between matter and consciousness) Class, we have previously learned about materialism. Can anyone provide some examples from everyday life?

(Raises hand, chosen to answer the question) Although we've learned that matter determines consciousness, in life, I often feel that there's a mysterious force echoing my actions. For instance, it feels like I'm living in a movie like 'The Truman Show'.

(Frowns, glancing at the teachers in the back row, feeling uneasy) Jiye, your statement is in complete contradiction to the principles of materialism. In life, we need to be realistic and pragmatic. The mysterious force you mentioned reflects an idealist worldview. Pay attention in class and stop letting your imagination run wild.
But that's just how I feel. I always sense that someone is watching my every move and then acting in a way that guides me down a path set by some unknown force.

(Looking at the monitor screen, appearing thoughtful) The kid has grown up. It seems we can't hide our secret project to secretly plan his growth anymore. Everyone needs to be more vigilant recently. Just hang on until Jiye gets into Tsinghua or Peking University, then our mission will be accomplished. We'll tell him the truth then. We need to find a way to keep him grounded; it seems like he needs to come home this afternoon.

(After the public class, calls Liu Jiye to the office alone) Jiye, your performance in class just now made the other teachers think that I haven't been teaching you well. My promotion prospects are now dashed. You don't need to attend classes this afternoon; go home and reflect on your performance in class today.

content.content: I'm sorry, teacher. I didn't mean to. The exams are coming up, and I'm feeling quite pressured with not getting enough sleep. I behaved improperly in class earlier, and I'm really sorry. Please don't be angry. I promise I'll help you with the Outstanding Teacher selection. I'm quite close with the principal's son; maybe there's still a chance.
I'm sorry, teacher. I didn't mean it. I just can't shake the feeling that someone is watching my every move and then acting to guide me down an unknown path. I hope you can forgive me!

I'm sorry, teacher. I didn't mean it. Given your teaching skills, I'm sure the evaluating teachers know you well enough to not let a student's blunder affect your chances for an award. Please don't worry too much about the impact of my actions on you.

I'm sorry, teacher. I didn't mean it. I've just been engrossed in the study of idealism recently, which is why I responded to your question using related perspectives. I'm very sorry, teacher. I know the principal's son; I can plead with him on your behalf.

question: #question#How should Liu Jiye respond to Mr. Luo to showcase his willingness to reflect and his excellent social skills, making the conversation comfortable and pleasant?

content.content: Okay, I understand the seriousness of the situation now. I will go home and reflect properly, thank you for giving me the opportunity, teacher. I'll make sure nothing like this classroom disruption happens again.
Okay, I understand the seriousness of the situation now. You’re right, teacher. I think if this hadn't happened in a public class, it wouldn't have been this severe. I'm sorry, teacher. I was wrong!
Okay, I understand the seriousness of the situation now. I'm sorry, teacher. I apologize, and I promise to acknowledge my mistakes and amend them, sparing you any further trouble.
Okay, teacher. I understand the seriousness of the situation now. I will heed your criticism and go home to reflect on my mistakes until you are no longer upset with me.

question: #question#In the conversation with Mr. Luo, how should Liu Jiye speak to demonstrate adherence to school rules and strict compliance?

dialog.content: I didn't expect you to not only have a poor attitude towards learning but also engage in such underhanded deeds. I absolutely detest nepotism. As far as I'm concerned, you don't need to come anymore, starting today!
Mr. Liu, please don't be like this. Calm down. I'll write a self-reflection and seriously think about what happened today.
(Receiving a call from Teacher Luo at school) Hello, Teacher Luo. Is something wrong with Jiye at this time?

Hello, Jiye’s father. Here’s the situation: Jiye's performance at school hasn't been great lately. His answers in class are all over the place. It’s somewhat common in the third year, but what's more serious is that he's thinking of using power and connections to open backdoors! I absolutely cannot tolerate this. From today, he doesn’t need to come to school anymore!

Liu Jiye was expelled and sent home. He felt out of sorts all day, thinking something was off at home. After returning, he asked Old Liu about it. Old Liu finally gave in and revealed everything from before. Enraged, Jiye left home, deeply hurt.

(Voice slightly calmer) It's okay, why don't you go home and get some rest today. It seems like you've been a bit off lately, and saying things like that in class probably wasn't intentional, maybe you've just been too stressed.

(Walking alone on the way home after school, with no other students in sight. In the distance, on the community basketball court, people are playing basketball, among them someone who seems to be Liu Jiye's grandmother. Jiye shouts towards the court) Grandma, how are you standing up? Not only are you walking fine, but you're also playing basketball!

profile.name: Grandmother
profile.public profile: A senior teacher invited by Liu Chenggang, pretending to be Liu Jiye's paralyzed grandmother since his kindergarten days. Her usual behaviors foster Jiye's good habits of respecting elders. Over the years, Jiye genuinely believes Teacher Cao is his real grandmother.
profile.goal: Help Liu Chenggang groom Jiye into a qualified business heir

dialog.content: Oh no, I just went out for a bit today and already ran into Jiye coming home early. Why did he come back without any notice? I’ve got to run, can't let him find out.
(Watching as his grandmother hurriedly leaves) You must be Grandma, right? Slow down, don't run so fast, wait for me!

(Teacher Cao rushes back home; Old Liu realizes his plan might be exposed. If it is, everything will fall apart. So he blocks the door.) Hey, Jiye, why are you back so early today? Did something happen at school?

There was a little issue at school, but don't worry about that now. I just saw Grandma playing basketball, which is impossible, right? Wasn't she paralyzed since I was in elementary school? How can she play basketball?
(Quickly tidying up and pretending to lie in bed) Who's back? Is it Jiye? Grandma hasn't gone anywhere; I've been lying at home all afternoon. Did you see wrong?

content.content: Impossible, I'm sure I didn't see wrong, Grandma, you were clearly playing basketball on the court earlier. And Dad, don't try to fool me anymore. I've always felt something was off. Aren't all these things at home staged and performed? I've thought about it for a long time, and our family life isn't real. Someone must be scripting and controlling my life.

Dad, I think you and Grandma have been acting. Are you rehearsing something? I really just saw Grandma playing basketball on the court, with no signs of paralysis. Are you acting something out? Is it to give me a surprise? I'm really happy if Grandma's paralysis is cured. If it's true, that would be wonderful!

Impossible, I'm sure I didn't see wrong, Grandma, you were clearly playing basketball on the court earlier. And Dad, don't try to fool me anymore. Grandma's paralysis is clearly cured. Even though I got criticized by the teacher today, seeing Grandma able to play basketball again makes me truly happy and glad that she's healthy and by my side!
Grandma, stop lying to me, you're wearing the exact same shoes that I saw on the basketball court. Tell me, is my guess correct? Has Grandma's paralysis been cured? Is it to give me a surprise?

question: #question# How should Liu Jiye express himself to show that even when faced with Old Liu's and Grandma’s scripted performances, he can still think independently, calmly analyze the situation, and reach the correct conclusion?

content.content: Really? There could be two possibilities: first, the person playing basketball wasn't Grandma but someone who looks a lot like her; second, that person was indeed Grandma, who, for some reason, can stand up again but hasn't told me.

Really? No way, I'm sure I didn't see wrong, Grandma, you were clearly playing basketball on the court earlier. And Dad, don't try to fool me, Grandma's paralysis is clearly cured. Even though I got criticized by the teacher today, seeing Grandma able to play basketball again makes me truly happy and glad that she's healthy and by my side!

Really, Grandma, did I see wrong? Did you really stay in bed all afternoon? I was criticized by the teacher today, so maybe I was in a bad mood and my eyes were blurry, mistaking someone else for you!

Really, Dad, I think you and Grandma have been acting. Are you rehearsing some show? I really just saw Grandma playing basketball on the court, with no signs of paralysis. Are you acting something out? Is it to give me a surprise? I'm really happy if Grandma's paralysis is cured. If it's true, that would be wonderful!

question: #question# How should Liu Jiye appropriately express himself to indicate his ability to swiftly and logically analyze clues when faced with Dad’s and Grandma’s rebuttals?

dialog.content: Son, your imagination is too wild. How could scenes from movies happen in real life?
You’re still denying it? Just now, Grandma was in such a hurry running down the road that she lost her shoe. I picked it up, isn't this the very shoe she always wears?
(Seeing there's no hiding it, he begins to soothe his son) Sorry, son. We have our reasons for doing this. Let me explain.
Reasons? Do you think simply saying you had reasons justifies everything? All my life, how many years have you lied to me? Tell me why you did all of this.

Old Liu tells his son that he fabricated everything to make him grow up in a challenging environment, so he wouldn't become entitled like other wealthy heirs. Jiye was stunned after hearing this and didn't speak for a long time. He quietly went back to his room and barely spoke with his family for a couple of years.
Don't think too much, let's skip studying today. Let your mom take you out for a walk and clear your mind. You've probably been under too much study stress lately.
(Ji Ye and Mom went out for a walk, Old Liu and Teacher Cao are discussing what to do next) Cheng Gang, what should we do next, with such a big mishap?
(Holding his forehead, thinking for a long time) There isn't a good way out; we'll just have to find a reason to let you step back for now.
(Coming back with his mom in the evening, seeing Old Liu standing sadly in the living room) Hey, Dad, where's Grandma? Why isn't she home?

(Having rehearsed several times, he begins his act) Ji Ye, Grandma... she's gone. What you saw on the basketball court today was indeed Grandma. She was gravely ill and experienced a burst of clarity at noon, which allowed her to stand up like a normal person, so she went to play basketball one last time. After the burst of clarity, her life quickly faded away; she left us while you were out. You don’t need to comfort us, just focus on your efforts.
What?! Grandma's gone, just now? That's too sudden!

(Having received Old Liu's message in advance, she begins to act along) I was wondering why Grandma kept talking about wanting to play basketball lately—it must have been her final burst of energy. Her last wish was fulfilled, Ji Ye, don’t cry, Grandma left without regrets.
Yeah, Grandma passed away peacefully. Her final wish was for you to get into Qingbei University. Once you do, make sure to tell her at her grave.

content.content: Grandma's passing was too sudden. Dad, you should take care of yourself too. Grandma not only wished for me to get into a good university but surely also wanted you and Mom to be healthy. Don't let grief take over. The teacher also taught us that filial piety is foremost. I'll take a break from school to be with you for a while.

Grandma's passing was too sudden. Was her wish really for me to get into Qingbei University? That's not Grandma's wish, it's yours. I understand your wishes for me to succeed, but right now I just want to see Grandma off. The teacher also told us that filial piety is foremost, so I'll take a break from school to accompany you and see Grandma off.

Mom and Dad, where's Grandma now? I want to see her one last time, don't stop me. I don't believe Grandma passed away just like that—my dearest Grandma, you must feel the same, right? (wailing) Grandma, where are you? Stay with us longer. You haven't seen me get into Qingbei yet, how can you leave first? Mom and Dad, the teacher said filial piety is foremost. I'll take a break and stay at home to accompany you.

Grandma's gone, my dear Grandma (seeing his parents in tears, he starts to wail too), we're all so heartbroken. How I wish Grandma could stay with us, healthy and grow old together. The teacher also taught us that filial piety is foremost. I'll take a break and stay home.

question: #question# How can Liu Ji Ye express understanding of his parents' feelings and effectively comfort them in the face of Grandma's passing?

content.content: (Speaking through sobs) Yeah, I won't let Grandma's expectations down. I'll dedicate myself 100% to getting into Qingbei University as a tribute to her.
Just this afternoon at school, I was saying the world is idealistic. There must be someone behind all of this. Dad, are you really my dad, or have you been an actor paid by someone all along?
Grandma's gone, and you keep talking about Qingbei. Is school really that important, more than my Grandma's life?
You're all liars, this is all fake. How could Grandma suddenly recover from paralysis and then leave in one day?

(Speaking through sobs) Yeah, where are Grandma's belongings? I want to sort them out. I won't forget any of her instructions. Grandma is watching over us and will bless us from above. Mom and Dad, we must live healthily and happily, not let her down!

(Speaking through sobs) Yeah, I won't let Grandma's love for me go in vain. I will grow up healthy and happy. Grandma will always keep an eye on me and love me from where she is. I'll always remember her!
(Speaking through sobs) Yeah, I'll always remember Grandma. Every year, I'll visit her grave to tell her about my experiences. I'll always cherish and love Grandma!

question: #question# How can Liu Ji Ye express that he's willing to fulfill the commitments and responsibilities conveyed in Grandma's last will?

dialog.content: (Pretending to cry) Boo hoo hoo, Jiye, my son, you've really grown up. I'm so relieved.
Before Grandma passed away, did she have any other wishes besides hoping I get into Tsinghua or Peking University? Surely there was more than just that.

She mentioned other things too, like wishing for our whole family to be healthy and safe, but her greatest wish was for your education. You really have to give it your all in this year's college entrance exam.
Alright, I understand. Let me take some time to recover. Once I get through this, I will definitely pull myself together and prepare for the exam with all my heart.

A week later, Jiye was overwhelmed with grief. Old Liu couldn't bear to watch and was worried his son was too deeply affected, so he finally told Jiye the truth. Jiye was initially shocked, then extremely angry, and he chose not to take the college entrance exam the following year. Eventually, he decided to study abroad and didn't contact his family for a long time.
Son, you’re amazing, and I'm proud of you. Don't be too upset, everything will pass.
(Time flies; it's almost the college entrance exam) Dad, I've been preparing thoroughly during this time, and there’s a good chance I’ll get into Tsinghua or Peking University.
No problem, you’ll definitely make it. You've been reviewing a lot, just approach the exam calmly tomorrow, and get some rest early.
Alright, you two stop discussing the exam. Jiye must have his own plans, and talking more will only add pressure on him. Go freshen up and sleep early.

After the exams, Liu Jiye successfully got into Tsinghua University. On the day the admission letter arrived, Old Liu revealed the whole truth to Jiye. Although it was uncomfortable, after going through so much, Jiye eventually accepted everything from the past. After graduating from Tsinghua University, Liu Jiye started working from the grassroots in his father's company, gradually familiarizing himself with the company's operations, and eventually became an excellent successor to the company.
